授業方法:
In principle, this class will be face-to-face; however, all class materials, tasks, and explanations will be posted in a Google Classroom dedicated to this class.

Depending on enrollment numbers and the evolving COVID-19 situation, course format may rotate between being instructor-led to student-led. The instructor will first introduce content of a given topic, then the student will make a presentation on the topic the following week. After each presentation, the teacher will offer feedback. You should have a stable wifi or internet connection at home to complete all out-of-class assignments.

第1回: Ice breakers and introduction to the course
第5回: How to say what you want to say
トピック.授業外学習2:
Students will be expected to prepare presentations (slides and scripts) outside of class. Around 2-3 hours of homework (weekly) can be expected in average, but towards the end of the semester, it could be more demanding.

During this course, you will complete four to six formal presentations that will be recorded for your review. However, there will be speaking tasks during every class which will help you become accustomed to speaking in front of an audience.
